dict.acceptation: （构思者）奇特的；昂贵的；（价格等）高价的；[美国俚语]真棒；

sent.orig: Fancy Nancy did not fancy doing fancy work.
sent.trans: 时髦的南希不喜欢做针线活。

sent.orig: Recalling the past film and television works, modeling, in the fancy division fancy technology constantly improving.
sent.trans: 回顾往昔的影视作品，造型师、化装师在不停的完善化装技术。

sent.orig: It was fancy footwork; too fancy, perhaps.
sent.trans: 这是奇怪的做法，简直是太奇怪了。

sent.orig: The Winter Palace was a hugescale prototype of fancy if fancy can have a prototype.
sent.trans: 圆明园是规模巨大的幻想的原型，如果幻想也可能有原型的话。

sent.orig: Fancy: if you think a person is attractive, you fancy them.
sent.trans: 迷恋：如果你觉得某人很迷人，你爱恋他们。
